page.title: 06ASHLEY REFUSE TIP
page.content: The{domestic refuse tip}at{Ashley}near {Tiverton}was opened by{Devon County {Council}in 1975 and covers an area of 8 acres of leased land. It serves the town of Tiverton and roughly a 10 mile radius. From April 1985 the site will no longer be used for depositing refuse and the land will be reinstated using surplus soil from the Eastern Distributor Road. It will subsequently be grassed and returned to the owner as agricultural grazing land. For about one more year Devon County Council will use it as a refuse collecting centre before transferring this to the{Punch Bowl site}near {Crediton.}When a large enough fleet of transport vehicles is available the refuse will go direct to{Sutton near {Honiton.
